user.biography: Stay on the cutting edge of practical science with my research review: ⬇💪🏻

node.text:
You gotta give Gary Taubes credit for being newsworthy :)... Here are my thoughts on renowned skeptic & science advocate Michael Shermer’s recent endorsement of Taubes and his crusade for keto.
#science #diet #evidencebased #keto #doyoueven

node.title: KETO: My thoughts on Shermer giving Taubes some shine

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Alan Aragon on August 13, 2021. May be an image of 9 people and text that says 'Early Career Influences & @thealanaragon alanaragon.com Inspirations 20'.

node.text:
I decided to do a whole other post instead of adding to my previous one because of the caption limit (2,200 characters, this caption is about double). For those who missed it, I’m simply giving credit to some of my earlier career influences. In the current digital age, it’s easier than ever to steal/adopt/take credit for ideas/protocols/products to either feed the ego or the bank account (or both). The art of citing sources is a dying flicker in the dark. Well, I’m not about that deal. Its only right to credit the folks who put in the blood, sweat, tears, and gray hair to pave the path for further progress. Swipe to read my commentary on each person. 
-
Row 1: Michael Colgan, Dan Duchaine, Will Brink (@will_brink)
Row 2: Jose Antonio (@the_issn), Brad Schoenfeld (@bradschoenfeldphd), Susan Kleiner (@powereat)
Row 3: James Krieger (@james.krieger), Bill Phillips (@billphillipsfitness), Lyle McDonald (doesn’t like to be tagged).
-
#creditwhereitsdue

Photo by Alan Aragon on August 13, 2021. May be an image of text that says 'Lyle McDonald (there's an infamous "don't tag me" joke here) is one of the most influential figures in the evidence-based niche. He was the first person to tell me that I need to write a book (this was back in 2006). Lyle has always been about 10 years ahead of the fitness industry in terms of "groundbreaking" ideas.'.
Photo by Alan Aragon on August 12, 2021. May be an image of 9 people and text that says 'Early Career Influences & Inspirations @thealanaragon alanaragon.com'.

node.text: My audience, on average, is about half my age. Unsurprisingly, much of my audience first found my work through my students who have ascended the industry ranks, and through influencers who I have influenced. I’m happy to say that I still see a handful of coaches & educators giving me credit for my work despite the fitness industry’s cutthroat competitive nature. This reminded me of the importance of giving credit where it’s due, by acknowledging individuals who blazed the trails for us and future generations of practitioners, coaches, athletes, and educators. Pictured is an incomplete collage of some of the earlier influences in my career journey. Can you name them? I’ll post more commentary tomorrow. #TBT #creditwhereitsdue #shouldersofgiants

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Alan Aragon on August 11, 2021. May be an image of 1 person and text that says 'Alan Aragon @TheAlanAragon Calories matter just like gravity matters. Many variables affect calorio balance. A "magic" diet or special eating pattern is only useful to the extent that it sustains the targeted calorio balance over time. A major barrier to weight loss maintenance is overconsumption of magic.'.

node.text:
To most of my audience, this is a reminder. To some of you, this is a revelation (welcome to enlightenment).😁

#humpday #science #standdowngurus

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Alan Aragon on August 08, 2021.

node.text:
John Meadows (@mountaindog1) is one of the best-loved people in the fitness & bodybuilding community/industry. I have spoken to him once on the phone, via @bradschoenfeldphd who was training with him in person. Of course Brad wanted to do some friendly trolling and throw John on the phone and make me guess who it was, without me ever having spoken to him prior to that :)… I’ve been a big fan of John’s work, & his products (T-shirt pic is of his incredible bars which were without a doubt the best-tasting ever). All John said was that he was a big fan of my work and that hopefully we’ll get to meet up & hang out soon. I insisted that pancakes be part of the deal. 

When I hit a low point in my personal and professional life a few years back, John reached out to me with compassion, comfort, and wisdom. My experience with John is not unique. His kindness, humility, and strength of character radiated toward everyone who has been fortunate enough to speak with him or call him a friend.

John will be sorely missed, but his spirit will live on. I’m sending my most sincere condolences and hopes for strength & serenity for his family in this extremely difficult time.

RIP John “Mountaindog” Meadows. We’ll meet one day on the other side. 

#inspirit

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Alan Aragon on August 02, 2021. May be an image of 1 person and text that says 'Alan Aragon @TheAlanAragon 3 steps to long-term dietary adherence: 1) Eat foods you personally prefer. 2) Eat at times that work best w/your preference, training goals, & schedule. 3) Allow/plan regular hedonic deviations from the routine. Bonus: don't let magic diet claims in various media distract you.'.

node.text:
Yeah, I know… Rebellious, controversial, and triggering stuff here. Toughest love is the bonus though. Easier said than done. :)… Happy Monday, let’s smash it💥
#realtalk #adherence #yesyoucanhavecarbspast9pm

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Alan Aragon on August 01, 2021. May be an image of sashimi and sushi.

node.text:
I’m a nutrition guy. My feed needs some food once in a while :)… This was Friday’s lunch. It’s not my typical lunch, it was more of a “Yay, Alan posted AARR” celebration. @jeana.aragon prepared the meal, and this is why I’m spoiled.

Hope you all are prepared for an awesome work week as Sunday winds down. Of course my fellow entrepreneurs don’t take weekends off, but that’s fine.😆😁👍🏼 #bigcolors

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Alan Aragon on July 30, 2021. May be an image of 1 person, standing and text that says 'AARR IS POSTED M ONS IN THE TRENCHES OR e ampiu Interview with Dylan Bair, MS, RD, LD -contest prep coach of elite competitors & champions. By Alan Aragon LONAL GOOD QUESTION Is the "10,000 steps a day" guideline rooted in good evidence? What about those who can't even break 5000 steps- are they doomed? By Alan Aragon EDITOR'S CUT Age-related anabolic resistance: overview, prevention, & mitigation. By Alan Aragon @thealanaragon alanaragon.com'.

node.text:
The new issue of AARR has been posted!!! Big thanks to the contribution of my friend Dylan Bair (@dylanbair_rd) - the legend behind the highly successful @bairaesthetics coaching company.

Featured in the pic are just a few highlights of the issue, there’s much more good stuff. Swipe left to read a message I got from an AARR subscriber, Detlev Corfeld (who happens to be a brilliant guy). I got his permission to post it, of course. :)

That’s my EAA-enriched spam for the day. Hope you all enjoy the issue. Those new to what I’m talking about, go here: alanaragon.com/aarr

PS - my recently released ebook that answers all of your burning questions about protein is available as a gift to current AARR subscribers. It’s also available for purchase for non-subbers (link is in my profile, alanaragon.com/books).

Thanks everyone, & happy Friday!

#aarr #evidencebasedfitness #doyouevenscience #knowledgeispower

We definitely have the nutrition nerdy thing in common as I'd happily settle for another forty years of reading it and boring my non-nerdy friends by incessantly talking about it!'.

Photo by Alan Aragon on July 28, 2021. May be an image of 1 person and text that says 'Alan Aragon @TheAlanAragon Ironically, in the quest to improve our diets to lose weight and improve our bodies, most people only lose their minds.'.

node.text: Changing the body is largely a mental game. If you lose your mind while dieting, you ain’t gonna change the body - not in the long-term. #adherence #sustainability #evidencebased #fadfree

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Alan Aragon on July 18, 2021. May be an image of 3 people and food.

node.text: Hey everyone, first pic is from yesterday (@jeana.aragon’s birthday - final year in her 40’s). The next pic is from tonight’s continuation of the fun. In-N-Out is our favorite burger joint. Fitting “indulgence” foods into an overall healthy diet is a matter of controlling their dose and/or frequency through the course of the day, week, or month. I limit burgers and fries to a couple of times a month, and I don’t worry about it. Out of my 100 or so meals per month, a maximum of about 4-6 are truly naughty. This flexible allowance for imperfection and indulgence keeps my social life, sanity, and sense of rebellion intact. Individuals vary in their personal level of dietary hedonic requirements. Finding that sweet spot is a powerful tool for long-term adherence to an overall healthy diet. Hope you all enjoyed your weekend, and are ready to hit the work week with a vengeance. #bam #boom #healthnutharderthanmeidareyou

Photo by Alan Aragon on July 17, 2021. May be an image of 1 person, beach and ocean.

node.text: Happy 49th birthday to my beautiful @jeana.aragon. This pic was taken yesterday, ain’t no throwback to the glory days - she is actually this glorious right now. IG is for highlight reels, but the fact is, my entire life is a highlight reel, thanks to her. Jeana is the best example of how great someone can be in all aspects. #birthdaylove

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Alan Aragon on July 16, 2021.

node.text:
So many nails, so little coffin :). While it’s always exciting to fall head-first for a magic bullet, sometimes reality is what hits the target.

Pictured are the key findings of a newly published (massive) review by Ashtary-Larky & colleagues (PMID: 34250885), which examined the ketogenic diet literature spanning back from 1921 to the present day.

#science #anticlimactic #nomagicbullet #nomagicpill
